document_data.name: Harbor Ward
document_data.mainbody: The '''Harbor Ward''' of [[Port Nyanzaru]] housed the majority of city's docks, including those used by its [[Merchant princes (Port Nyanzaru)|merchant princes]]. It was a busy place where ships were loaded and unloaded, allowing for goods to flow in and out of the port.
document_data.Location: The Harbor Ward lay along the harbor on the northside of the city. The Ward sat between the [[Port Nyanzaru/Merchants' Ward|Merchants' Ward]] to the west and the [[Port Nyanzaru/Market Ward|Market Ward]] to the east.{{Cite adventurers league/A City on the Edge|5}} A network of caves, said to contain an old temple to [[Umberlee]], lay beneath the streets of the ward.{{Cite adventurers league/Peril at the Port|30}}
document_data.Description:
[[File:Port Nyanzaru harbor.jpg|thumb|350px|''A view of the harbor.'']]
The harbor itself was built to be highly defensible against pirates, and featured a defensive chain that could be raised to block entrance or exit to the harbor. The harbor's [[Lighthouse (Port Nyanzaru)|lighthouse]] that could be used to send smoke signals which could be seen all across the [[Bay of Chult]].

The Dock Ward bustled with [[dinosaur]]s and dockhands ready to help load and unload ships, notably with the aid of dinosaur-powered [[crane]]s,While the map of Port Nyzanzaru provided with the ''[[Tomb of Annihilation]]'' adventure places the Royal Docks on the western end of the Harbor Ward, they are described in the text as being on the eastern end. Between the Royal Docks and the public docks was a drydock and the [[Port Nyanzaru/Warehouse District|Warehouse District]].

During heavy rains, runoff from the ravine of [[Malar's Throat]] would stream into the city and empty into the harbor, often carrying with it [[basket]]s, dead animals, and sometimes an unlucky person.

Notable Locations.Landmarks:
:;Docks:Known to be much more convenient than the docks of [[Tiryki Anchorage]] thanks to the dockhands and dinosaurs ready to help with cargo, the docks of Port Nyanzaru were also known to be heavily policed, and visitors were subject to many inspections.
:;Dry dock: Not used for shipbuilding, but rather for dinosaurs to drag ships ashore to be repaired, patched, or cleaned of [[barnacle]]s.
:;[[Lighthouse (Port Nyanzaru)|Lighthouse]]: The fires of this tower illuminated the way for ships sailing around Chult and could be seen for miles along the coast.
:;[[Na N'buso]], the Great King: This statue was erected in the late 15{{th}} century DR and depicted a mythic [[Chultan (ethnicity)|Chultan]] king adorned in full royal dress.
:;[[Royal Docks (Port Nyanzaru)|Royal Docks]]: Used exclusively by Port Nyanzaru's merchant princes or their guests (including ambassadors and influential foreign merchants).
:;[[Serpent's Coil]]: This secret smugglers' tunnel could be accessed via an abandoned building at the eastern edge of the ward, and led to Tiryki Anchorage outside the wall.{{Cite adventurers league/A City on the Edge|7-8}}

document_data.Inhabitants:
The docks were often filled with incoming visitors and treasure hunters seeking guides, as well as [[thieves]] and con artists looking to take advantage of them. On occasion, when brigands or mercenaries put into port, the docks could also become a dangerous place.{{Cite dragon+/16/Fiction: Qawasha & Kupalu√© Part Two}}

The Chultan [[druid]] and guide [[Qawasha]] would sometimes spend his Summer days at the docks, greeting visitors and providing a trustworthy welcome to Chult.
